client_password.description: The username to authenticate against Foreman. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_CLIENT_PASSWORD`. Defaults to `""`.

client_tls_insecure.description: Whether or not to verify the server's certificate. Defaults to `false`.

client_username.description: The username to authenticate against Foreman. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_CLIENT_USERNAME`. Defaults to `""`.

location_id.description: The location for all resources requested and created by the providerDefaults to "0". Set organization_id and location_id to a value < 0 if you need to disable Locations and Organizations on Foreman older than 1.21

organization_id.description: The organization for all resource requsted and created by the Provier Defaults to "0". Set organization_id and location_id to a value < 0 if you need to disable Locations and Organizations on Foreman older than 1.21

provider_logfile.description: Where to deirect provider-specific log output. A value of '-' preserves the default behavior of the log package from Golang stdlib and will be combined with the main terraform.log file produced by terraform. If the desired output file does not exist, it will be created. If the file already exists, logs will be appended to the file. This can also be set through the enviornment variable `FOREMAN_PROVIDER_LOGFILE`. Defaults to `'terraform-provider-foreman.log'`.

provider_loglevel.description: The level of verbosity for the provider's log file. This setting determines which types of log messages are written and which are ignored. Possible values (from most verbose to least verbose) include 'DEBUG', 'TRACE', 'INFO', 'WARNING', 'ERROR', and 'NONE'.  The provider's logs will be written to the location specified by `provider_logfile`. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_PROVIDER_LOGLEVEL`. Defaults to `'INFO'`.

server_hostname.description: The hostname / IP address of the Foreman REST API server

server_protocol.description: The protocol the Foreman REST API server is using for communication. Defaults to `"https"`.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of an instruction set architecture (ISA).

name.description: The name of the architecture. Valid characters: ^[A-Za-z0-9-_.]+$. @EXAMPLE "i386"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this architecture

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of computeresource. ComputeResources serve as an identification string that defines autonomy, authority, or control for a portion of a network.

displaytype.description: For Libvirt: "VNC" or "SPICE". For VMWare: "VNC" or "VMRC"

hypervisor.description: The HyperVisor/Cloud Provider for this Compute Resource:supported providers include "Libvirt", "Ovirt", "EC2","Vmware", "Openstack", "Rackspace", "GCE"

password.description: Password for oVirt, EC2, VMware, OpenStack. Secret key for EC2

url.description: URL for Libvirt, oVirt, OpenStack and Rackspace

user.description: Username for oVirt, EC2, VMware, OpenStack. Access Key for EC2.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of default Template. Default Templates serve as an identification string that defines autonomy, authority, or control for a portion of a network.

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system to assign this Default Template to

templatekind_id.description: Template Kind Id to define the Default Template

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of domain. Domains serve as an identification string that defines autonomy, authority, or control for a portion of a network.

name.description: The name of the domain - the full DNS domain name. @EXAMPLE "dev.dc1.company.com"

parameters.description: A map of parameters that will be saved as domain parameters in the domain config.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY A puppet environment, branch.

name.description: Name of the environment. Usually maps to the name of a puppet branch. @EXAMPLE "production"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of common_parameter. Global parameters are available for all resources
@SUMMARY A host managed by Foreman.

bmc_success.description: Tracks the partial state of BMC operations on host creation. If these operations fail, the host will be created in Foreman and this boolean will remain `false`. On the next `terraform apply` will trigger the host update to pick back up with the BMC operations. @UNEXPORTED

comment.description: Add additional information about this host.Note: Changes to this attribute will trigger a host rebuild.

compute_attributes.description: Hypervisor specific VM options. Must be a JSON string, as every compute provider has different attributes schema

domain_id.description: ID of the domain to assign to the host.

enable_bmc.description: Enables PMI/BMC functionality. On create and update calls, having this enabled will force a host to poweroff, set next boot to PXE and power on. Defaults to `false`.

environment_id.description: ID of the environment to assign to the host.

hostgroup_id.description: ID of the hostgroup to assign to the host.

image_id.description: ID of an image to be used as base for this host when cloning

medium_id.description: ID of the medium mounted on the host.

method.description: Chooses a method with which to provision the HostOptions are "build" and "image"

model_id.description: ID of the hardware model if applicable

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system to put on the host.

owner_id.description: ID of the user or usergroup that owns the host.

owner_type.description: Owner of the host, must be either User ot Usergroup

parameters.description: A map of parameters that will be saved as host parameters in the machine config.

retry_count.description: Number of times to retry on a failed attempt to register or delete a host in foreman.

attached_devices.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. 'eth1', 'eth2' as comma-separated list

attached_to.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs.

bmc_provider.description: Provider used for BMC/IMPI functionality. Values include: `"IPMI"`

identifier.description: Identifier of this interface local to the host.

ip.description: IP address associated with the interface.

mac.description: MAC address associated with the interface.

managed.description: Whether or not this interface is managed by Foreman.

password.description: Associated password used for BMC/IPMI functionality.

primary.description: Whether or not this is the primary interface.

provision.description: Whether or not this interface is used to provision the host.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet to associate with this interface.

type.description: The type of interface. Values include: `"interface"`, `"bmc"`, `"bond"`, `"bridge"`.

virtual.description: Whether or not this is a virtual interface.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Hostgroups are organized in a tree-like structure and inherit values from their parent hostgroup(s). When hosts get associated with a hostgroup, it will inherit attributes from the hostgroup. This allows for easy, shared configuration of various hosts based on common attributes.

architecture_id.description: ID of the architecture associated with this hostgroup.

compute_profile_id.description: ID of the compute profile associated with this hostgroup.

domain_id.description: ID of the domain associated with this hostgroup.

environment_id.description: ID of the environment associated with this hostgroup.

medium_id.description: ID of the media associated with this hostgroup.

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system associated with this hostgroup.

parameters.description: A map of parameters that will be saved as hostgroup parameters in the group config.

ptable_id.description: ID of the partition table associated with this hostgroup.

puppet_ca_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet certificate authority server for this hostgroup.

puppet_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet proxy server for this hostgroup.

pxe_loader.description: Operating system family. Values include: "None", "PXELinux BIOS", "PXELinux UEFI", "Grub UEFI", "Grub2 UEFI", "Grub2 UEFI SecureBoot", "Grub2 UEFI HTTP", "Grub2 UEFI HTTPS", "Grub2 UEFI HTTPS SecureBoot", "iPXE Embedded", "iPXE UEFI HTTP", "iPXE Chain BIOS", "iPXE Chain UEFI"

realm_id.description: ID of the realm associated with this hostgroup.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet associated with the hostgroup.

title.description: The title is the fullname of the hostgroup.  A hostgroup's title is a path-like string from the head of the hostgroup tree down to this hostgroup.  The title will be in the form of: "<parent 1>/<parent 2>/.../<name>".

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Defining HTTP Proxies that exist on your network allows you to perform various actions through those proxies.

name.description: The name of the http proxy. @EXAMPLE "proxy.company.com"

url.description: Uniform resource locator of the proxy. @EXAMPLE "https://proxy.company.com:8443"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of image.
@SUMMARY Content Credentials are used to store credentials like GPG Keys and Certificates for the authentication to Products / Repositories.

content.description:
Public key block in DER encoding or certificate content. @EXAMPLE "-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----
...
-----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Poducts are mostly operating systems to which repositories are assigned.
@SUMMARY Repository

ansible_collection_requirements.description: Contents of requirement yaml file to sync from URL.@EXAMPLE

checksum_type.description: Checksum of the repository, currently 'sha1' & 'sha256' are supported@EXAMPLE "sha256"

content_type.description: Product the repository belongs to. Valid values include:`"deb"`, "docker"`, "file"`, "puppet"`, "yum"`.@EXAMPLE "yum"

deb_architectures.description: Comma separated list of architectures to be synched from deb-archive.@EXAMPLE

deb_components.description: Comma separated list of repo components to be synched from deb-archive.@EXAMPLE

deb_releases.description: Comma separated list of releases to be synched from deb-archive.@EXAMPLE

docker_tags_whitelist.description: Comma separated list of tags to sync for Container Image repository.@EXAMPLE

docker_upstream_name.description: Name of the upstream docker repository@EXAMPLE

download_concurrency.description: Used to determine download concurrency of the repository in pulp3. Use value less than 20. Defaults to 10@EXAMPLE

download_policy.description: Product the repository belongs to. Valid values include:`"immediate"`, "on_demand"`, "background"`.@EXAMPLE "immediate"

http_proxy_policy.description: Policies for HTTP proxy for content sync. Valid values include:`"global_default_http_proxy"`, "none"`, "use_selected_http_proxy"`.@EXAMPLE "global_default_http_proxy"

ignorable_content.description: List of content units to ignore while syncing a yum repository. Must be subset of rpm,drpm,srpm,distribution,erratum@EXAMPLE

ignore_global_proxy.description: If true, will ignore the globally configured proxy when syncing.@EXAMPLE true

mirror_on_sync.description: true if this repository when synced has to be mirrored from the source and stale rpms removed.@EXAMPLE true

unprotected.description: true if this repository can be published via HTTP.@EXAMPLE true

upstream_password.description: Password of the upstream repository user used for authentication.@EXAMPLE "S3cr3t123!"

upstream_username.description: Username of the upstream repository user used for authentication.@EXAMPLE "admin"

verify_ssl_on_sync.description: If true, Katello will verify the upstream url's SSL certifcates are signed by a trusted CA.@EXAMPLE true

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY A sync plan is used to schedule a synchronization of a product in katello

cron_expression.description: Custom cron logic for sync plan.@EXAMPLE "*/5 * * * *"

description.description: Sync plan description.@EXAMPLE "A sync plan description"

interval.description: How often synchronization should run. Valid values include: `"hourly"`, `"daily"`, `"weekly"`,`"custom cron"`.@EXAMPLE "daily"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Remote installation media.

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this media.

path.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).  For example:

http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch

Where $arch will be substituted for the host's actual OS architecture and $version, $major, $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system. 

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release. @EXAMPLE "http://mirror.averse.net/centos/$major.$minor/os/$arch"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Vendor-specific hardware model.

hardware_model.description: Name of the specific hardware model.

info.description: Additional information about this hardware model.

name.description: The name of the hardware model. @EXAMPLE "PowerEdge FC630"

vendor_class.description: Name or class of the hardware vendor.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of an operating system.

parameters.description: A map of parameters that will be saved as operating system parameters in the os config.

password_hash.description: Root password hash function to use. Valid values include: `"MD5"`, `"SHA256"`, `"SHA512"`, `"Base64"`.

release_name.description: Code name or release name for the specific operating system version.

title.description: The operating system's title is a concatentation of the OS name, major, and minor versions to get a full operating system release.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of parameter. Parameters serve as an identification string that defines autonomy, authority, or control for a portion of a network.

domain_id.description: ID of the domain to assign this parameter to

host_id.description: ID of the host to assign this parameter to

hostgroup_id.description: ID of the host group to assign this parameter to

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system to assign this parameter to

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet to assign this parameter to

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY The disk partition layout of the host.

audit_comment.description: Any audit comments to associate with the partition table. The audit comment field is saved with the template auditing to document the template changes.

host_ids.description: IDs of the hosts associated with this partition table.

hostgroup_ids.description: IDs of the hostgroups associated with this partition table.

layout.description: The script that defines the partition table layout. @EXAMPLE "void"

locked.description: Whether or not this partition table is locked for editing.

name.description: The name of the partition table. @EXAMPLE "AutoYaST LVM"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating system associated with this partition table.

snippet.description: Whether or not this partition table is a snippet to be embedded in other partition tables.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Provisioning templates are scripts used to describe how to bootstrap and install the operating system on the host.

audit_comment.description: Notes and comments for auditing purposes.

locked.description: Whether or not the template is locked for editing.

name.description: Name of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "AutoYaST default"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this provisioning template.

snippet.description: Whether or not the provisioning template is a snippet be used by other templates.

template.description: The markup and code of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "void"

template_kind_id.description: ID of the template kind which categorizes the provisioning template. Optional for snippets, otherwise required.

environment_id.description: The environment ID for this template combination.

hostgroup_id.description: The hostgroup ID for this template combination.

block.description:
How templates are determined:

When editing a template, you must assign a list of operating systems which this template can be used with.  Optionally, you can restrict a template to a list of host groups and/or environments.

When a host requests a template, Foreman will select the best match from the available templates of that type in the following order:

  1. host group and environment
  2. host group only
  3. environment only
  4. operating system default

Template combinations attributes contains an array of hostgroup IDs and environment ID combinations so they can be used in the provisioning template selection described above.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Smart proxies provide an API for a higher-level orchestration tool. Foreman supports the following smart proxies: DHCP (ISC DHCP & MS DHCP servers), DNS (bind & MS DNS servers), Puppet >= 0.24.x, Puppet CA, Realm (FreeIPA), Templates, TFTP.

name.description: The name of the smart proxy. @EXAMPLE "dns.dc1.company.com"

url.description: Uniform resource locator of the proxy. @EXAMPLE "https://dns.dc1.company.com:8443"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of a subnetwork.

boot_mode.description: Default boot mode for instances assigned to this subnet. Values include: `"Static"`, `"DHCP"`.

dhcp_id.description: DHCP Proxy ID to use within this subnet

dns_primary.description: Primary DNS server for this subnet.

dns_secondary.description: Secondary DNS sever for this subnet.

domain_ids.description: Domains in which this subnet is part

from.description: Start IP address for IP auto suggestion.

gateway.description: Gateway server to use when connecting/communicating to anything not on the same network.

httpboot_id.description: HTTPBoot Proxy ID to use within this subnet

ipam.description: IP address auto-suggestion for this subnet. Valid values include: `"DHCP"`, `"Internal DB"`, `"Random DB"`,`"None"`.

network_address.description: The Subnets CIDR in the format 169.254.0.0/16

network_type.description: Type or protocol, IPv4 or IPv6, defaults to IPv4.

template_id.description: Template HTTP(S) Proxy ID to use within this subnet

tftp_id.description: TFTP Proxy ID to use within this subnet

to.description: Ending IP address for IP auto suggestion.

vlanid.description: VLAN id that is in use in the subnet

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY User can be used to allow access to foreman.

admin.description: If the user is allow admin privileges

auth_source_id.description: Set the authentication source, i.e internal (1,default) or external (2)

default_location_id.description: Default location for the user, if empty takes global default

default_organization_id.description: Default organization for the user, if empty takes global default

locale.description: Sets the timezone/location of a user

location_ids.description: List of all locations a user has access to

organization_ids.description: List of all organizations a user has access to

password.description: Password of user, required if auth_source_id is 1 (internal)

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Usergroups can be used to organize permissions and ownership of the hosts.

admin.description: Is an admin user group.@EXAMPLE true

user.description: Username for oVirt, EC2, VMware, OpenStack. Access Key for EC2.

When hosts get associated with a hostgroup, it will inherit attributes from the hostgroup. This allows for easy, shared configuration of various hosts based on common attributes.

template_combinations_attributes.description:
How templates are determined:

When editing a template, you must assign a list of operating systems which this template can be used with.  Optionally, you can restrict a template to a list of host groups and/or environments.

When a host requests a template, Foreman will select the best match from the available templates of that type in the following order:

  1. host group and environment
  2. host group only
  3. environment only
  4. operating system default

Template combinations attributes contains an array of hostgroup IDs and environment ID combinations so they can be used in the provisioning template selection described above.

template_kind_id.description: ID of the template kind which categorizes the provisioning template. Optional for snippets, otherwise required.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Smart proxies provide an API for a higher-level orchestration tool. Foreman supports the following smart proxies: DHCP (ISC DHCP & MS DHCP servers), DNS (bind & MS DNS servers), Puppet >= 0.24.x, Puppet CA, Realm (FreeIPA), Templates, TFTP.

name.description: The name of the smart proxy. @EXAMPLE "dns.dc1.company.com"

url.description: Uniform resource locator of the proxy. @EXAMPLE "https://dns.dc1.company.com:8443"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of a subnetwork.

boot_mode.description: Default boot mode for instances assigned to this subnet. Values include: `"Static"`, `"DHCP"`.

dhcp_id.description: DHCP Proxy ID to use within this subnet

dns_primary.description: Primary DNS server for this subnet.

dns_secondary.description: Secondary DNS sever for this subnet.

domain_ids.description: Domains in which this subnet is part

from.description: Start IP address for IP auto suggestion.

gateway.description: Gateway server to use when connecting/communicating to anything not on the same network.

httpboot_id.description: HTTPBoot Proxy ID to use within this subnet

ipam.description: IP address auto-suggestion for this subnet. Valid values include: `"DHCP"`, `"Internal DB"`, `"Random DB"`,`"None"`.

network_address.description: The Subnets CIDR in the format 169.254.0.0/16

network_type.description: Type or protocol, IPv4 or IPv6, defaults to IPv4.

template_id.description: Template HTTP(S) Proxy ID to use within this subnet

tftp_id.description: TFTP Proxy ID to use within this subnet

to.description: Ending IP address for IP auto suggestion.

vlanid.description: VLAN id that is in use in the subnet

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY User can be used to allow access to foreman.

admin.description: If the user is allow admin privileges

auth_source_id.description: Set the authentication source, i.e internal (1,default) or external (2)

default_location_id.description: Default location for the user, if empty takes global default

default_organization_id.description: Default organization for the user, if empty takes global default

locale.description: Sets the timezone/location of a user

location_ids.description: List of all locations a user has access to

organization_ids.description: List of all organizations a user has access to

password.description: Password of user, required if auth_source_id is 1 (internal)

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Usergroups can be used to organize permissions and ownership of the hosts.

admin.description: Is an admin user group.@EXAMPLE true
